  <!-- ======== START OF CLASS DATA ======== --> 
  <h2> <font size="-1"> org.owasp.esapi.reference.validation</font> <br> Class CreditCardValidationRule</h2> 
  <pre>java.lang.Object
  <img SRC="../../../../../resources/inherit.gif" ALT="extended by "><a href="../../../../../org/owasp/esapi/reference/validation/BaseValidationRule.html" title="class in org.owasp.esapi.reference.validation">org.owasp.esapi.reference.validation.BaseValidationRule</a>
      <img SRC="../../../../../resources/inherit.gif" ALT="extended by "><b>org.owasp.esapi.reference.validation.CreditCardValidationRule</b>
</pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dt>
    <b>All Implemented Interfaces:</b> 
   </dt>
   <dd>
    <a href="../../../../../org/owasp/esapi/ValidationRule.html" title="interface in org.owasp.esapi">ValidationRule</a>
   </dd> 
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <dl> 
   <dt>
    <pre>public class <b>CreditCardValidationRule</b>
     <dt>
      extends 
      <a href="../../../../../org/owasp/esapi/reference/validation/BaseValidationRule.html" title="class in org.owasp.esapi.reference.validation">BaseValidationRule</a>
     </dt></pre>
   </dt>
  </dl>  
  <p> A validator performs syntax and possibly semantic validation of Credit Card String from an untrusted source. </p>
  <p> </p>
  <p> </p>
  <dl> 
   <dt>
    <b>Since:</b>
   </dt> 
   <dd>
    June 1, 2007
   </dd> 
   <dt>
    <b>Author:</b>
   </dt> 
   <dd>
    Jeff Williams (jeff.williams .at. aspectsecurity.com) 
    <a href="http://www.aspectsecurity.com">Aspect Security</a>
   </dd> 
   <dt>
    <b>See Also:</b>
   </dt>
   <dd>
    <a href="../../../../../org/owasp/esapi/Validator.html" title="interface in org.owasp.esapi"><code>Validator</code></a>
   </dd>
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <p>

  <a name="CREDIT_CARD_VALIDATOR_KEY">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> CREDIT_CARD_VALIDATOR_KEY</h3> 
  <pre>protected static final java.lang.String <b>CREDIT_CARD_VALIDATOR_KEY</b></pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    Key used to pull out encoder in configuration. Prefixed with "Validator." 
    <p> </p>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>See Also:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <a href="../../../../../constant-values.html#org.owasp.esapi.reference.validation.CreditCardValidationRule.CREDIT_CARD_VALIDATOR_KEY">Constant Field Values</a>
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd>
  </dl>

  <a name="CreditCardValidationRule(java.lang.String, org.owasp.esapi.Encoder)">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> CreditCardValidationRule</h3> 
  <pre>public <b>CreditCardValidationRule</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;typeName,
                                <a href="../../../../../org/owasp/esapi/Encoder.html" title="interface in org.owasp.esapi">Encoder</a>&nbsp;encoder)</pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    Creates a CreditCardValidator using the rule found in security configuration 
    <p> </p>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Parameters:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code>typeName</code> - a description of the type of card being validated
     </dd>
     <dd>
      <code>encoder</code> - 
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd>
  </dl> 
  <hr>

  <a name="getValid(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> getValid</h3> 
  <pre>public java.lang.String <b>getValid</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;context,
                                 java.lang.String&nbsp;input)
                          throws <a href="../../../../../org/owasp/esapi/errors/ValidationException.html" title="class in org.owasp.esapi.errors">ValidationException</a></pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    Parse the input, throw exceptions if validation fails 
    <p> </p>
   </dd>
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Parameters:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code>context</code> - for logging
     </dd>
     <dd>
      <code>input</code> - the value to be parsed 
     </dd>
     <dt>
      <b>Returns:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      a validated value 
     </dd>
     <dt>
      <b>Throws:</b> 
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code><a href="../../../../../org/owasp/esapi/errors/ValidationException.html" title="class in org.owasp.esapi.errors">ValidationException</a></code> - if any validation rules fail
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <a name="validCreditCardFormat(java.lang.String)">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> validCreditCardFormat</h3> 
  <pre>protected boolean <b>validCreditCardFormat</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;ccNum)</pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    Performs additional validation on the card nummber. This implementation performs Luhn algorithm checking 
    <p> </p>
   </dd>
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Parameters:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code>ccNum</code> - number to be validated 
     </dd>
     <dt>
      <b>Returns:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      true if the ccNum passes the Luhn Algorithm
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <a name="sanitize(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> sanitize</h3> 
  <pre>public java.lang.String <b>sanitize</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;context,
                                 java.lang.String&nbsp;input)</pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    The method is similar to ValidationRuile.getSafe except that it returns a harmless object that 
    <b>may or may not have any similarity to the original input (in some cases you may not care)</b>. In most cases this should be the same as the getSafe method only instead of throwing an exception, return some default value. 
    <p> </p>
   </dd>
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Specified by:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code><a href="../../../../../org/owasp/esapi/reference/validation/BaseValidationRule.html#sanitize(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)">sanitize</a></code> in class 
      <code><a href="../../../../../org/owasp/esapi/reference/validation/BaseValidationRule.html" title="class in org.owasp.esapi.reference.validation">BaseValidationRule</a></code>
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Returns:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      a parsed version of the input or a default value.
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <a name="setStringValidatorRule(org.owasp.esapi.reference.validation.StringValidationRule)">
   <!-- --></a>

  <dl> 
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Parameters:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code>ccrule</code> - the ccrule to set
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
  </dl>

  <a name="getMaxCardLength()">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> getMaxCardLength</h3>
